content.description:
In the wild west days of ranching and gold mining in J Tree, Bill Keys and Worth Bagley had an argument and settled it like men and Bill Keys murdered Bagly and then made a sign telling everyone he killed Mr. Bagley because he was being a bitch. Now almost 70 years later the world is filled with softies who need a safe space. Don't be bitch like Bagley and climb this route.

Probably the best route here. Head up the crack, place a cam down low in the crack and then with gear down below your feet pull up and over the flake and finish up an off width crack placing more gear to the top.
content.protection: Light rack. Bolted anchor. Don't put cams behind the flake.
content.location: Right at the corner of the crag by a downed burnt tree.

content.description: An easy crack on the left side of the crag. Start at a wide crack and follow it up and right as it curves to the top. It has some awkward hand foot matches as you're walking to the anchor at the top. Remember to place gear for the follower.
content.location: Far left side of the crag. From the approach trail scramble over the boulders to the left, go around the corner and up to the end of the wall.

content.description: This is the first crack you will get to from the approach. Head straight up and a little to the right placing gear as you go and up into a squirmy gritty chimney.
content.protection: light rack up to #4 theres a crack in the chimney that takes medium cams. Bandaids for after because you will bleed.
content.location: Right at the base by some boulders. Its the furtherst to the right route.

content.description: J tree and Tahquitz have ski tracks carved into the rock, this spot just has little baby snowblade tracks. Follow the 2 thin curving cracks up and left, traverse out grab an undercling and then top out, throw a direction in for your bud and walk right and clip the anchors.
content.location: Far left around the corner. you start near an old star drive in bolt.

content.description: A link up of 2 routes. Start up Worth Bagley or on of the cracks just to the left and then top it out to a mini ledge and head up calfsmoke to the top.
content.location: Right at the corner of the crag

content.description: Head up Squrimney and then cut right pretty early across a ledge with a bush then head up clip a lone bolt and muscle your way to the top.
content.protection: light rack, one bolt, and bolted anchors

content.description: Head up Squirmney and towards the top cut right following a thin seam. Follow the seam for 10 feet clipping 2 rusty pitons (Don't get too excited Royal Robbins didn't put these in, I did).  Then put in another cam and pull up to the top.Throw a directional in for your bud and clip the bolted anchors.
content.protection: Light rack, 2 rusty pins (already fixed ready to clip), and bolted anchors.

climbs.name: The Face from Nowhere
climbs.fa: Waiting for a clean TR ascent...could it be you?

content.description: The face from nowhere...Theres an awesome hard face at the top right of the crag but you can't really get to it. You could do a direct start and climb some death burnt crumbly slab but no, you can bush whack up the hill and traverse in but thats still blank and weird too. If you figure it out, the face is fun. I just rap in 1/2 way and TR solo the top face.
content.protection: TR anchors at top then  walk out along the ridge thing and clip the bolt as a directional.
content.location: Far right side of the crag

content.description: Start up Squirimney and go straight up the hanging bulgy crack flake thing. follow it up a coarse grainy slab.

After this route your calfs will be smoking

Head up the curving hand crack/layback/undercling into a fist crack. Shake you calfs out and follow the thin crimpy crack left smearing your feet until you hit a jug and top out.
content.protection: Buff calfs, light rack, bolted anchor
content.location: just around the corner of the crag

content.description:
Bolt ladder up a blank slab to have fun practicing aid climbing.

Easy moves straight up the bulges put in a cam and start clipping bolts and cheating your way to the top with those ladder thingys. There's 1 janky rivet hanger in for fun but you don't need any fancy aid gear.

Prolly goes free at 5.14. But you'd deck and die if you fell onto the 1/4 bolt rivet hanger so don't try and be a hero.
content.location: Just to the left of Squimney
